info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 2:06AM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 10 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region Zone. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 PM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Friday afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
